Posts.Content: Sandra, Thank you so much for the info, trust me when I say I have been searching for answer's for ten year's now up to and includeing a recent Cat Scan. And the end result of that was, the doctor said yes you do have scar tissue. Well I already knew that when asked what can be done about they tell me nothing. Darla
Posts.Title: Breast cancer scar tissue

Posts.Content: Ten years ago I had breast cancer and had a bilateral mastectomy, the scar tissue in my chest is so bad it is hard for me to breath and needless to say I have been miserable.Does anyone have any ideas or suggestions to soften scar tissue. I thought with time it would soften but it has not.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer scar tissue

Posts.Content: Hi Leea, Thank you for your comment. I'm told that because I have Lupus as well that that this contributes to the tightness in my chest and as a result between that and the scar tissue I feell 24/7 like I have a wide leather strap pulled tight around my chest. You would think that after ten years one would just get use to it, but you dont. To be quite honest it has made my life a living hell. I'm happy to hear that you are doing so well. Darla
